intro: Neochilenia aerocarpa, commonly known as the sky bladder, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to South America. It is characterized by its unique, inflated fruit that resembles a balloon, which helps in seed dispersal by wind. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are usually small and pinnately divided, while the stems are often branched and covered in a fine, hairy layer. The botanical features of Neochilenia aerocarpa make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and evolutionary botany.
